page.title: 11Employment,Newton/Linton
page.content: The villages were once inhabited mainly by agricultural workers.The coming of the R.A.F.to Linton-on-Ouse, farm mechanisation and the sale of Beningbrough Hall Estate has changed both Linton and Newton.The R.A.F.has provided local employment. Some people,especially men,work for Airwork Ltd.,civilian contractors to the R.A.F.Few people work on the local farms and many commute to York and other places of employment.Among these are Social Service workers, police, teachers, architects and professional people. A number of people are self-employed and include a coal retailer,joiner, builders,painter and decorator, undertaker,dressmaker, shop keepers,garage proprietor, publicans and farmers .All at Widdington are connected with farming. Unemployment is small and mostly seasonal.
